answers.answer: try to refrain from all forms of seafood esp. prawns and crabs. Some friends have got rid of that problem within weeks. You shd try it out.

If you have been on any antibiotics over the last few years at all - you could have triggered a candida infection. That is when normally in control yeast in your body goes out of control. It feeds on sugars you eat as well...On the other side, most people are also comsuming more and more Splenda which can cause a reaction you are describing...the candida and Splenda reactions won't always cause a visible rash but, cause itch. Lastly, I would talk to an allergist and see if they can test some common foods and environmental triggers on you...the candida is a simple stool test - the allergy testing is more costly and involved.  Keep us posted!
Thanks!  I will definitely try them all, because I am at my wits end when it comes to this.

meant to mention too that Diabetes can start with an itch too...in general - I'd see a general practioner..some causes of itch:sugars (glucose levels)hormones (out of whack)allergies (seasonal, environmental, food)candida (yeast overgrowth)andrenal gland, autoimmune problems
